The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced on Wednesday that it would reinstate a policy requiring non-Mexican asylum seekers to remain in Mexico while their U.S. immigration cases proceed. Trump implemented a version of the policy in late 2018, but it was declared illegal by a federal judge and suspended by the Biden administration in late January.

But now, the administration has reversed course and will move forward with the same policy under a new name, the Department of Homeland Security announced. They are calling it "The Migration Protection Protocols" (MPP).

Immigrant rights groups, however, are up in arms over the decision, arguing that the policy will effectively block asylum seekers from accessing the U.S. and is essentially just a continuation of Trump's policies.

"The Administration is recycling policies from the Trump Playbook, abandoning their campaign promises of restoring and strengthening our nation's commitment to legal immigration and human rights," Melissa Turcios, a spokesperson for the Immigrant Defense Project, said in a statement Wednesday.

DHS said the policy is designed to help manage the influx of asylum seekers and prevent the "misuse" of the asylum system. It is estimated that more than 70,000 migrants are currently waiting in Mexico for their U.S. immigration court dates.

The Trump administration defended its use of the program by saying it would help alleviate the strain on the U.S. asylum system, which has been overwhelmed by a surge of migrants from Central America in recent years.

But immigrant rights advocates have argued the policy only serves to punish those fleeing violence and persecution in their home countries, while allowing the government to duck responsibility for its own policy failures.

"The truth is this policy will continue the Trump administration's legacy of denying access to the asylum system for vulnerable migrants, including children and families who have fled violence and persecution," Marielena Hincapie, executive director of the National Immigration Law Center, said in a statement Wednesday.

The policy also raises concerns about the safety of asylum seekers, given the risk of violence in some of the Mexican cities they are being sent to.

"This policy is wrong, it's inhumane, and it flies in the face of basic human rights," Hincapie said.

Immigrant rights groups are now calling on the Biden administration to reverse course on its decision and restore more humane asylum policies. They argue that the U.S. should be doing more to ensure the safety of asylum seekers, not less.

"The Administration must quickly move away from these wrongheaded policies, which are an affront to human rights, justice and decency," Turcios said.

The Biden administration has yet to respond to the outcry from immigrant rights groups. But with the new policy set to take effect within weeks, the pressure is sure to mount on the White House to reverse course.

text:
When you get a raise, it can be exciting — especially after you’ve been working hard and diligently to move up the career ladder. But what’s the best thing to do with the extra money? 

While it may be tempting to splurge on a fancy new car or that dream vacation, financial planner Kathleen Grace says there are smarter ways to use a raise.

"The best thing to do with a raise is to start budgeting," Grace says. "It’s important to track where you are spending and to have an understanding of what is left to save."

Having a budget also can help you identify areas where you can cut back — like dining out or going to the movies — so you can save more.

The next thing Grace recommends is to start an emergency fund. It’s generally a good idea to have three to six months worth of expenses saved up in case of a job loss or an unexpected medical expense.

"It’s important to build up your emergency fund for when something unexpected happens, because it’s one of the most important ways to protect yourself financially," she explains.

Grace adds that if you already have an emergency fund, you should use your raise to add to it. You also can use some of your extra money to pay down debt or contribute more to your retirement account.

It's also important to look at the tax implications of your raise. Grace recommends meeting with an accountant or tax professional to make sure you understand your tax bracket and the impact a raise could have on your taxes.

"Most people don’t understand the tax implications of their raise,” she says. “If you’re in a high tax bracket and have a large raise, you may want to start setting aside some of that money to pay taxes.”

Grace says it’s also important to set financial goals to ensure you’re taking advantage of your raise. Ask yourself what you want to accomplish with this extra money, whether it’s paying off debt, contributing more to your retirement or taking a vacation.

"If you’re already setting aside money for savings and retirement, then you may want to make some additional investments or purchase something you’ve been wanting for a while,” she says.

The key is to keep your long-term financial goals in mind and make sure you’re taking advantage of your raise in the most efficient way possible.

"Having a financial plan is the most important thing," Grace says. "It will help you set goals, track spending and ensure that you’re investing your money in the most productive way."

Remember that getting a raise is an exciting time, and if you use it wisely, it can have a lasting impact on your financial future. With the right budget, emergency fund and tax strategy, you can make the most of your raise and secure a more prosperous financial future.

text: The dew point is the temperature at which air becomes saturated with water vapor and dew (tiny water droplets) forms. When air is cooled, it can hold less water vapor. So if the air is cooled enough, the excess water vapor will condense into dew. The dew point is measured in degrees because it is the temperature at which this condensation occurs. Just like temperature, the dew point is measured on a scale (in this case, the Celsius or Fahrenheit scale). Imagine you have a glass of ice water on a hot day. The air around the glass is hot and humid, which means it has a lot of water vapor in it. As the air touches the cold glass, it cools down. When the air gets cold enough, it can't hold onto all of the water vapor it had before. Some of the water vapor turns into tiny droplets of water on the outside of the glass. This is just like how dew forms on grass and other surfaces when the air is cooled to the dew point.

Even more concerning is the changing landscape of the job market—some fields are booming, while others are on the brink of extinction. However, a trend that is becoming increasingly evident among employers is the rise of “quiet hiring.”

This hiring method, though relatively new, could become the go-to style of recruitment in the U.S. in 2023, according to HR expert Rebecca Garvey. Speaking to CNBC_papers, Garvey explained that she expects the trend to continue due to its cost-effective, efficient and successful nature. 

“Quiet hiring is an approach to talent recruitment that is increasing in popularity among employers due to its cost savings,” Garvey said. 

The concept is simple—instead of advertising open positions, businesses rely on their networks of former employees and referrals from current workers for help. It’s believed that if a former employee has had a successful experience working for a particular organization, they’ll be more likely to refer their friends or colleagues.

The result is that employers can avoid costly job boards and advertising campaigns. This, in turn, helps them to keep their hiring costs to a minimum while still being able to access a pool of talented applicants.

Garvey explains that businesses can benefit from quiet hiring in other ways too. She states that relying on referrals and previous employees can help employers save time on the recruiting process as they don’t have to wade through as many resumes and applications. 

Quiet hiring also ensures that businesses are able to access a pool of talented workers who are a great fit for their organization. By relying on referrals from their networks, employers can be sure that any applicant they take on has already been vetted to some extent. 

According to Garvey, businesses should begin preparing for the growing trend of quiet hiring. 

“I think employers need to start getting familiar with quiet hiring and using it more,” she said. “If employers don’t start using it, they may be at a disadvantage in 2023 because other businesses are likely to be relying more and more on this approach.”

Garvey recommends that businesses develop a robust referral program and ensure that they have good relationships with their current and former employees. She also stresses that businesses should make sure they’re utilizing social media outlets such as LinkedIn to access even more talent.

Overall, Garvey expects that quiet hiring is going to become an increasingly popular option for businesses in 2023 due to its cost savings, efficiency and success rate. Businesses should start preparing for this trend now in order to be successful in the future job market.

The price of gasoline has been driven largely by international and domestic events, including the ongoing pandemic, production cuts in the US, the OPEC+ agreement to reduce crude oil production, and fluctuations in the US dollar.

The pandemic has had an outsized impact on the price of gasoline. As people stayed home, drove less, and rode public transportation more, demand for gasoline fell drastically, leading to a steep drop in prices.

At the same time, the OPEC+ agreement led to production cuts in crude oil, which also drove up gasoline prices. As production in the US fell due to the pandemic, prices rose even higher.

The volatility of the past year makes it tough to predict what will happen in the coming year. The pandemic is still ongoing, and it’s difficult to predict how much longer it will last. The US Energy Information Administration predicts that US production will remain relatively steady in 2021, although there are still uncertainties.

OPEC+ also agreed to increase crude oil production beginning in January, and that could also lead to lower gasoline prices.

The US dollar has also been a factor in the price of gasoline. When the dollar is weak, gasoline prices tend to be higher, as the US imports more crude oil from abroad. The dollar has been largely unchanged since mid-2020, but economists expect it to strengthen next year.

The biggest wild card for 2021 is the vaccine. If it is successful in reducing the spread of the virus, it could lead to a recovery in demand for gasoline, and higher prices.

Overall, it’s difficult to predict what will happen with gasoline prices in 2021. The uncertainty could lead to prices that remain volatile for the foreseeable future. Consumers should keep an eye on global developments and be prepared for whatever 2021 may bring.

" Said another way , the closer you are to the thing you 're orbiting , the faster you go . It 's how comets have predictable orbits around the sun . Because there are n - body perturbations on all orbits , no orbit is ever stable . text: What would be the consequences if they do realize their error some day   in the far future? You've informed them of the error and they've informed you that nevertheless the points are yours and you should use them. So you have a couple of issues: have you made what your jurisdiction considers a reasonable effort to correct the mistake, and did the customer service rep actually have the authority to make such a large goodwill gesture as letting you keep all the points? The first is your legal responsibility (otherwise you're stealing), and you need to know specifically for your jurisdiction whether a phone call is sufficient. I can't tell you that. Maybe you should send them a letter, maybe you should wait until you've had written confirmation from them, maybe you're OK as you are. You might be able to get free advice from some body that helps with consumer issues (here in the UK you could ask Citizen's Advice). The second is beyond your ability to know for sure but it's not dishonest to work on the basis that what the company's proper representative tells you, is true. With the usual caveats that I'm not qualified to give legal advice: once told you've been clearly told that it's an intentional gift, I don't see any way you could be held to have done anything fraudulent if you then go about enjoying it. The worst case "far future" problem, I would expect, is that someone decides the gift was never legitimately made in the first place. In other words the company made two separate errors, first crediting the card and then telling you the erroneous points stand. In that case you might have to pay them back whatever you've spent on the card (beyond the points you're entitled to). To avoid this you'd need to establish what constitutes a binding gift in your jurisdiction, so that you can say "no, the point balance was not erroneous and here's the legal reason why", and pay them nothing. You might also need to consider any tax implications in receiving such a large gift, and of course before paying tax on it (if that's necessary) you'd probably want to bug them for confirmation in writing that it really is yours. If that written confirmation isn't forthcoming then so be it, they've rescinded the gift and I doubt you're inclined to take them to court demanding that they stand by the words of their rep. Use them and play stupid. It's not my duty to check their math, right?  That's potentially fraud or theft if you lie. You did notice, and even worse they have proof you noticed since you made the call. So never say you didn't notice. If you hadn't called them (yet), then you've been given something in error, and your jurisdiction will have an opinion on what your responsibilities are. So if you hadn't already called them, I would strongly suggest that you should call them or write to them about it to give them the opportunity to correct the error, or at least seek assurance that in your jurisdiction all errors in the customer's favour are final. Otherwise you're in the position of them accidentally handing you their wallet without realising, and you deciding to keep it without telling them. My guess is, that's unlikely to be a legally binding gift, and might legally be theft or fraud on your part.

Hotel star ratings are ubiquitous, from budget motels to five-star resorts, yet many travelers are left wondering what the stars actually mean. Although the rating system is quite simple, there is a vast range of options and amenities among hotels at any given star level. To shed some light on the subject, we’ve put together this guide to understanding the star system and what to expect from each rating.

One Star

At the lowest end of the rating scale, one-star hotels offer basic accommodations and may not have extensive amenities. They are typically found in rural areas and are ideal for budget travelers looking for a clean, safe and simple place to sleep without frills.

Two Star

Two-star hotels offer modest amenities and basic services. The rooms tend to be small but modern, and the price is reasonable. These hotels often offer complimentary Wi-Fi, a bar or restaurant on site, an outdoor pool and small extras like hairdryers.

Three Star

Three-star hotels tend to offer more features than two-star hotels, including larger rooms, more modern facilities and better service. You’ll also likely get complimentary breakfast and often find in-room amenities like coffee makers.

Four Star

Four-star hotels are usually large and luxurious, offering a range of amenities such as swimming pools, spa services, fitness centers and on-site restaurants. The service is usually excellent and there are usually several restaurants, bars and lounge areas. These hotels usually cater to business travelers and offer meeting and event spaces.

Five Star

At the top end of the scale are five-star hotels, typically located in major cities or resorts. These hotels provide guests with a wide range of services, amenities and experiences. They feature luxurious rooms and suites with high-end features such as deep soaking tubs, multiple HDTVs and well-stocked minibars. Many five-star hotels offer private butlers, concierge services, valet parking, in-room dining and spa services.

So, when it comes to star ratings, the sky’s the limit. From one to five stars, hotels offer guests a range of amenities, services and experiences that are sure to fit your budget and needs. Make sure to do your research ahead of time and read reviews to get an accurate picture of the star rating of each hotel. That way, you’ll get the most out of your hotel experience.

text:
Wenn man sich anschaut, was es in 2020 für die globale Klimabewegung gegeben hat, dann sind diese vier Erfolge unter dem Strich besonders erwähnenswert:

Erstens, es hat einen interessanten Entwicklungsschritt gegeben, als China angekündigt hat, seine Treibhausgas-Emissionen zu erhöhen, nachdem sie 2020 auf ein 20-Jahres-Tief gesunken sind. China ist der weltweit größte Verursacher von Treibhausgasen und damit für mehr als ein Viertel der weltweiten Treibhausgas-Emissionen verantwortlich. Ein weiterer Anstieg der Emissionen hätte einen erheblichen Einfluss auf das Klima gehabt. Die jüngste Ankündigung Chinas, dass es seine Bemühungen zur Reduzierung der Emissionen bis 2060 fortsetzen wird, war ein echter Durchbruch für die Klimabewegung.

Zweitens, 2021 hat eine wichtige Wiedergeburt des Paris Climate Agreements gesehen, als die Europäische Union und mehrere andere Länder die Entscheidung getroffen haben, zusammenzustehen und das Abkommen zu stärken. Das Abkommen verspricht, das Niveau der globalen Erwärmung um mehr als zwei Grad zu senken, und es hat viele wichtige Ziele, die erreicht werden müssen, bevor das möglich ist. Das Abkommen ist ein wichtiger Schritt in Richtung Klimaschutz, und es ist wichtig, dass es von vielen Ländern unterstützt wird.

Drittens, es hat in der vergangenen Zeit einen regelrechten Boom bei sauberen Energie-Technologien gegeben. Obwohl es immer noch einige Hürden gibt, die überwunden werden müssen, hat die fortschrittliche Technologie den Weg zu sauberer und nachhaltiger Energieerzeugung bereitet. Eine wichtige Rolle in dieser Hinsicht spielt die Solar- und Windenergie, die für eine saubere Energieerzeugung immer wichtiger werden. Weitere Entwicklungen in diesem Bereich sind zu erwarten, und auch die Menschheit hat das Potenzial, in nicht allzu ferner Zukunft nahezu kohlenstoffneutral zu werden.

Viertens, es hat sich eine kulturelle Veränderung in Bezug auf das Klima vollzogen. Menschen, vor allem jüngere Generationen, waren immer mehr bereit, das Klima als ein ernstes Problem anzuerkennen, und mehr Politiker haben angefangen, die Herausforderung anzunehmen. Darüber hinaus sind viele Unternehmen auf den Zug der Nachhaltigkeit aufgesprungen und bieten klimafreundlichere Produkte und Dienstleistungen an. Das bedeutet, dass immer mehr Menschen bereit sind, den Klimawandel ernst zu nehmen und etwas dagegen zu unternehmen. 

In den letzten zwei Jahren ist viel passiert, aber es ist auch viel mehr möglich. Es ist zwar noch viel zu tun, aber mit den vier Erfolgen, die wir heuer feiern können, sind wir definitiv auf dem richtigen Weg. Es liegt an uns, uns darum

text: Okay , the first thing to get straight is this : 3 on the left and 7 on the right does NOT mean you have 21 speeds to choose from . This is important . It 's really more like 9 , as I 'll explain in a bit . The numbers 1 to 3 are for the front gears , which are the ones inside the pedals . 1 to 7 are for the rear gears , on the back wheel . Let 's talk about those ones first . 1 is the easy gear , it 's what you should be using for going up steep hills . You probably wo n't use it for much else . 7 is for downhill , or maybe just flat ground if you want to go fast . Most of the time I 'd guess that you 'd have the rear on about 5 or 6 . Now , about the front gears . You set these depending on which rear gear you 're using . For example front 1 goes with back 1 to 3 . Front 2 goes with back 3 to 5 . Front 3 goes with back 5 to 7 . The reason you do this is to keep the chain straight . If you use front 1 with back 7 , the chain will be running diagonally across the cogs ( spiky wheels that the chain runs on ) and your equipment will wear out pretty quickly . So use the rear gears ( 1 to 7 ) to determine your speed , and think of the front ones ( 1 to 3 ) only in relation to which rear one you 're on . Hope that makes sense !

text: A dot product is a way to find out how much one vector points in the same direction as another vector. It is also called the scalar product because it returns a scalar (a single number) as a result.  To find the dot product of two vectors, you need to multiply the corresponding elements (the elements that are in the same position in both vectors) and then add them together.  For example, let's say you have two vectors:  Vector A: [1, 2, 3] Vector B: [4, 5, 6]  The dot product of these two vectors would be (1 * 4) + (2 * 5) + (3 * 6) = 4 + 10 + 18 = 32  So, in this case, the dot product is 32.  The dot product can be used to find the angle between two vectors, or to see if two vectors are perpendicular (at a right angle to each other). It can also be used in geometry and physics to solve problems involving forces and motion.

text: Supervised learning is a type of machine learning in which a model is trained to make predictions based on a set of labeled data. In supervised learning, the data used to train the model includes both input data and corresponding correct output labels. The goal of the model is to learn a function that maps the input data to the correct output labels, so that it can make predictions on unseen data.    For example, if we wanted to build a supervised learning model to predict the price of a house based on its size and location, we would need a dataset of houses with known prices. We would use this dataset to train the model by feeding it input data (size and location of the house) and the corresponding correct output label (price of the house). Once the model has been trained, it can be used to make predictions on houses for which the price is unknown.    There are two main types of supervised learning: classification and regression. Classification involves predicting a class label (e.g., "cat" or "dog"), while regression involves predicting a continuous value (e.g., the price of a house).    In summary, supervised learning involves training a model on a labeled dataset to make predictions on new, unseen data. The model is trained to map the input data to the correct output labels, and can be used for either classification or regression tasks.

It's the start of a new year, and many are looking to make positive changes in their life. Some might have marriage on the mind, hoping that this year will bring a greater connection between them and their partner. For one reader, however, her relationship with her husband has been distant and moody, leading her to reach out to Dear Abby for advice on how to approach the issue.

Dear Abby,

I’ve been married to my husband for a few years now and it feels like things are not where they should be. We are distant and he can be very moody, often preferring to be alone or out of the house. We don’t spend much quality time together and it’s a struggle to get him to open up to me about his feelings. I want to make our marriage work, but I feel like I’m putting in all the effort and he’s not meeting me halfway. What should I do?

Sincerely,

Wondering

Dear Wondering,

It sounds like you have been dealing with a difficult situation in your marriage. It can be hard when you feel like you are the only one putting in effort while the other person stays distant and moody.

The first thing you should do is talk to your husband openly and honestly about your concerns. Ask him what he thinks the source of the disconnect is, and if there are any underlying issues that you can work on together. This is an important step, as it will help you both understand each other better, and start building trust and intimacy in your relationship.

There is no “one size fits all” answer for how to fix a marriage, but there are a few things you can do to help improve the situation. It’s important to continue to be understanding and patient with your husband, as this can make it easier for him to open up to you. Additionally, try to make the effort to do activities together, such as going for a walk or cooking dinner. Spending quality time with your partner can be an important factor in bringing the two of you closer.

Finally, if it seems like your husband’s moods are causing too much strain in your relationship, it may be helpful to speak with a therapist. A therapist can provide the two of you with professional guidance, helping you both gain a better understanding of your situation and learn how to better communicate with each other.

No marriage is perfect, and it can be hard when your partner isn’t meeting you halfway. But with patience and effort, it is possible to work through this and make your marriage strong again.

Sincerely,

Abby

Flies use their legs to touch and interact with each other, and palpating may be a way for them to signal to other flies that they are ready to mate or to defend their territory.  So, when you see a fly rubbing its legs together, it could be doing it for any of these reasons. text: The ELI5 version of this is that it interferes with a plant 's ability to build amino acids . Amino acids are simple ( well , for organic chemistry ) molecules that are combined to form proteins , which are all of the building materials for life . What makes glyphosate , the active ingredient in Roundup , a clever herbicide is that it only acts on what 's called the " shikimic acid pathway " , which is a particular method of synthesizing these amino acids . It turns out that all animals get these particular amino acids from plants in our diet , so glyphosate has no known ill effects in humans - we do n't rely on this particular method for our needs . Why is it considered bad : this is complicated . The easiest criticism to understand is that it 's way , way overused . Essentially , we 're raining death on the plant world increasingly more in production agriculture , simply because it 's so effective . Too much of a good thing . It has a tendency to run off of fields when overused , to the point where we 've been able to see it in aquifers and streams far from fields , where , presumably , it could still kill plants in a high - enough concentration . It 's also greatly linked with Roundup Ready plants , plants which have had their genes modified to be resistant to roundup ( the shikimic acid pathway is modified in such a way as for the glyphosate molecules to no longer be as sticky as they are in non - modified plants , so they ca n't gum up the works and prevent the amino acids from forming ) . For those who oppose GMO plants , Roundup is sort of an enabler for the technology . Monsanto , the company which produces Roundup and Roundup Ready plants , has a long history of not being very responsible in a " big picture " sort of way ( e.g. Agent Orange , DDT , and PCBs were products of theirs as one of a number of chemical companies providing these goods ) , and they 've been known to use monopolistic practices in businesses that harm farmers by squeezing their finances from all sides - providing the seeds , providing the Roundup , and ~~owning the grain elevators that take the grain after its grown~~ * * Edit : it was pointed out to me that Monsanto does n't actually own the grain elevators . * * _ Hard to keep track of these sort of things : the agriculture business , like all of corporate America , is full of lots of corporation games . For instance , just parcel out what happened when [ Monsanto merged with Pfizer ] ( URL_0 ) - so far as I can tell , that move spawned 2 new companies as subsidiaries of Pfizer , then a decade later Pfizer sold its controlling interest when things got hairy . Maybe ? Who owns what is hard to track . Mea culpa . _ . Finally , there have been some rumblings that Roundup , or glyphosate more specifically , _ may _ act as a carcinogen in very large enough doses ; the mechanism , as far as I know , is still unknown , but it 's this last that 's put it in the news recently . Still , as a herbicide , you ca n't get much better than Roundup : it kills plants with no known serious harmful effects on the farmers and field workers who use it . It all has to be taken in context - is it better or worse than backbreaking hand - weeding ? Hard to say definitively . tl;dr : much of what is " wrong " with Roundup is due to the political and technological environment in which it 's being used - sort of how , say , gasoline is not a villainous liquid , but it _ has been _ a big part of global warming due to how we use it . And , I hate to have to do this , but a disclaimer : I 've been totally burned in any post where I string the letters G , M , and O back to back : people loooove to draw a line in the sand on them for some reason . This answer is not meant to speak for or against them . Whether or not you agree with genetically modified organisms , I hope that nobody turns this into a huge flame war , as GMOs are not inherently part of the question asked . I tried to address the issues as neutrally as possible , with fairly balanced coverage , but there 's always someone who loves to hop in and pick apart any aspect of this that does n't sit well with them while ignoring those parts that are in favor of their viewpoint . Not trying to be super paranoid , but let 's just all agree to play nice , shall we ? OK , back to your regularly scheduled Reddit experience :) EDIT : Correction about Monsanto owning grain elevators and extent of Monsanto 's involvement in chemical manufacturing . Credits to u / CricketPinata and u / dtiftw EDIT2 : I guess there 's no proactive way to ask people not to troll off of your post :/ These are not my opinions , people , but rather an attempt to provide a balanced digest of these topics . When someone asks " what 's the big deal with something " , if I hear people say that they do n't like that thing , I 'll put it in , whether or not I agree . It 's intent is journalism , not editorializing . Not even yellow journalism : I strive to be as balanced as possible , as evidenced by " tentatively may cause cancer ; method unknown " followed immediately " ca n't get much better than Roundup " . Feel free to ( politely ! ) correct any facts I got wrong , but any opinions in here are not necessarily my own , so flaming me is pointless . Being the shot messenger gets old real fast .

text: Your funds are in a retirement account.  Withdrawals from your IRA will be penalized if you withdraw before you turn 59.5 years old, and you appear to be decades away from that age. The general advice I would give you is to pick a "target year fund" that targets the year you turn 59.5.  The stock market is more volatile, but its average gains will protect you from inflation just eating your funds.  Bonds are in counterpoint to your stocks - more stable, and protecting you from the chance that stocks dip right before you want to withdraw. Target year funds start with higher amounts of stock, and gradually rebalance towards bonds over time.  Thus, you take your market risks earlier while you can benefit from the market's gains, and then have stability when you actually would want to retire and depend on the savings.

SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong Un sacked the country's second-highest military official on Friday after a reshuffle of the ruling party's top decision-making body, state media reported.

Kim dismissed Vice-Marshal Hwang Pyong So from his posts as vice-chairman of the powerful Central Military Commission and director of the military's General Political Bureau, both of which hold considerable influence in the North's military affairs.

The move comes after Kim reshuffled the country's ruling Workers' Party of Korea's Central Committee on Wednesday, in an apparent bid to gain more control over the military and the party. The reshuffle was accompanied by the retirement of some top military and political figures.

The move by Kim indicates he is seeking to consolidate his control over the military and the party ahead of his fourth five-year term as leader of the reclusive, authoritarian state.

"Kim's reshuffle is intended to ensure that his control of the Workers' Party and military will remain undiminished," said Hong Min, a senior analyst at the Seoul-based Korea Institute for National Unification.

Hwang, 71, had been a key military aide to Kim since 2013 and played a role in negotiating with South Korea to hold a summit between Kim and South Korean President Moon Jae-in in 2018.

Kim has since come under international pressure to open up his economy and abandon nuclear weapons.

Hwang's departure is the latest in a series of reshuffles that have seen the dismissal of top military and political officials since the party's last major reshuffle in 2017.

Most recently, in October, Kim Jae Ryong, the premier of the North's rubber stamp legislature, was removed from his post without explanation.

Kim has sought to tighten his grip on the party and the military since assuming power following the death of his father in 2011.

He has ramped up the country's nuclear weapons program and engaged in a war of words with the United States, including trading personal insults with U.S. President Donald Trump.

While Kim has held summits with the United States, Russia and China in recent years, those meetings have so far failed to ease tensions between North Korea and the international community or to win any concessions from Washington.

Kim's relationship with the United States has further soured in recent months over Pyongyang's ballistic missile tests and alleged violation of U.N. Security Council resolutions.

Analysts said Hwang's sacking appeared to be a clear sign that the leader intends to take a hard line on relations with the United States and its allies.

"Hwang's ousting suggests that Kim Jong Un will not budge on the issue of denuclearization, and that he will pursue economic opening with a slower, steadier approach," said Hong.

[ source ] ( URL_0 ) The vast majority of the world 's population lives in roughly 25 - 75 % urbanization , so one could theorize roughly 62.5 % of the world 's population could be killed a ' first strike ' . [ 1 ] Which as overall survival of the human race things go , not so bad . 37.5 % of people are still alive . To kill them we need to go after the food chain . Also known as nuclear winter . Now this is where krakatoa comes into play . We want to aim for a good 30C drop in global temperatures , so we 'll aim to triple . Krakatoa 's dust content . Now form a typical 1Mt nuclear device you get about 100 t of dirt lifted into the air . Dirt has a density of 120pounds per cubic foot , so 16 cubic feet , or 453 litres . [ 1 ] Now we need to triple krakatoa , so about ~3,300,000 litres of dirt . Which calls for 7284Mt of Nukes , or at ~300Kt each 21,855 ( rounding up ) . The number of current nuclear devices is ~17,300 which they all are n't 300Kt devices . Some are MUCH more . Overall , we really do n't know . And we really do n't want to find out . “It’s a really frustrating thing to have to deal with,” he said. “I understand people might need food but it’s not right to take advantage of us delivery drivers.”

White isn’t the only delivery driver to speak out on the issue. Other drivers, like Kaitlyn Jones, have also shared similar experiences.

Silencers, also known as suppressors, are devices that are attached to the barrel of a gun and are designed to reduce the amount of noise and muzzle flash that is produced when the gun is fired.

When a gun is fired, the bullet is propelled out of the barrel by a rapidly expanding gas. This gas is what causes the loud noise and bright flash that is associated with gunfire.

Silencers work by allowing the gas to expand slowly and cool off as it passes through a series of tubes or chambers inside the suppressor. This helps to reduce the noise and flash that is produced when the gun is fired.

As for the second part of your question, the silencers in movies often do not sound like real ones. The 117th Congress that was sworn in last month has already had its first major scandal revealed, this one concerning financial transparency.

On Thursday, the government watchdog group Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington (CREW) released a report that found 78 members of the 117th Congress had violated the STOCK Act, a law designed to prevent members of Congress from taking advantage of their insider knowledge of the legislative process to make money on the stock market.

According to the report, 78 of the 541 members of Congress — more than 14% — had bought or sold at least one stock within 90 days of the start of their term, which the STOCK Act prohibits.

The STOCK Act was passed in 2012 after a series of stories in the Wall Street Journal and other outlets revealed that lawmakers were trading stocks based on information they obtained through their positions in Congress.

text: Memory leaks occur when a program allocates memory for a specific purpose and then fails to properly release that memory when it is no longer needed. This can happen if the program has a bug that causes it to hold on to the memory even when it is no longer needed, or if the program simply forgets to release the memory.  The consequence of a memory leak is that the program will gradually use up more and more memory over time, even when it is not doing anything. This can cause the program to crash or run slowly, and can also cause problems with the rest of the computer if it runs out of memory.  To prevent memory leaks, it is important for programmers to make sure that they properly release any memory that is no longer needed by their program. This can be done by using tools that help identify memory leaks, or by carefully reviewing the code to make sure that all allocated memory is properly released.

However, even though their 'taste' in cars didn't changes, as their incomes increased, it finally reached the point where doing their own repairs was too much of a time sink, so the value of really old cars dropped in their minds and they shifted to buying newer cars and selling them before they completely fell apart. text:
As the world continues to grapple with the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and a resurgence of influenza, researchers have identified a new source of hospitalizations in the United States: respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV.

RSV is a common infection that primarily affects young children and the elderly, but it’s had a disproportionate impact on vulnerable communities during this pandemic. In recent years, RSV has been responsible for an estimated 3.2 million U.S. hospitalizations each year, and it’s estimated to cause up to 7.1 million deaths worldwide annually.

To help understand the scope of the problem, researchers from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the American Association of Public Health (AAPHS) developed a comprehensive tracking system for all three conditions: influenza, COVID-19 and RSV. The system, called eTRACKRSV, combines population-level health data from hospitalizations and mortality from 33 states across the country.

The tracking system uses data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS), the National Ambulatory Medical Care Survey (NAMCS), and other sources to monitor and identify regional hospitalization trends related to influenza, COVID-19 and RSV. It also provides trend analyses of regional and national hospitalization trends, allowing health officials to identify areas at greatest risk for infection.

Data collected by the eTRACKRSV system suggests that there’s an ongoing presence of RSV in the United States throughout the pandemic, particularly in the South, Midwest and Mountain regions. Between October 2019 and October 2020, the CDC found that RSV hospitalizations increased by 31%, while COVID-19 hospitalizations increased by 35%. The highest rates of RSV hospitalizations were reported in Arizona, Louisiana and Mississippi, followed by North Carolina and Tennessee.

In the months since the pandemic began, it’s become clear that healthcare providers are facing unprecedented levels of infection from both COVID-19 and RSV. This is why eTRACKRSV is such an important tool for health officials. It helps identify regions with high rates of RSV hospitalizations and can provide insights into how best to respond.

For instance, health officials can use the data to determine which regions need additional support and resources to better manage their RSV cases. The system can also be used to identify areas with a greater need for influenza and COVID-19 vaccination and testing programs.

As the world continues to grapple with the pandemic, it’s important to monitor the impact of RSV hospitalizations in order to ensure that vulnerable populations have access to the best possible care. With eTRACKRSV, researchers and health officials can better understand the regional trends related to RSV and develop more effective prevention strategies.

text: Ant colony optimization (ACO) is a heuristic optimization algorithm that is inspired by the behavior of ant colonies. Ant colonies are able to solve complex problems, such as finding the shortest path between their nest and a food source, by using simple rules and communication through pheromone trails. ACO algorithms use a similar process to find approximate solutions to optimization problems.    In ACO, a set of artificial ants is used to search for good solutions to the problem. Each ant builds a solution by constructing a path through a graph, with the quality of the solution being determined by the cost of the path. The ants communicate with each other through pheromone trails, which are used to indicate the desirability of different paths.    As the ants search for solutions, they leave pheromone trails on the paths they take. These trails serve as a kind of "memory" for the ants, allowing them to remember which paths are good and which are not. Over time, the pheromone trails on the most desirable paths become stronger, while the trails on less desirable paths fade away. This process allows the ants to adapt their search strategies as they learn more about the problem.    ACO algorithms have been applied to a wide range of optimization problems, including scheduling, routing, and resource allocation. They are particularly well suited to problems that involve finding the shortest path through a large, complex graph.

text: There are several potential causes of stomach pain and cramps during dialysis. Medications: Some medications used during dialysis, such as phosphate binders and acid-reducing medications, can cause stomach upset and cramping.  Infection: A bacterial or viral infection can cause stomach pain and cramping.  Ulcer: An ulcer (a sore in the lining of the stomach or intestine) can cause stomach pain and cramping.  If your husband is experiencing stomach pain and cramping during dialysis, it is important that he speak with his healthcare provider.
